intro: Amparoa ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules that disperse its seeds by wind. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Amparoa ehrenbergii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing food for desert wildlife.
